image.altText: A generic graphic image including a gold dollar sign and some websites.

props.synopsis: Cybercriminals have stolen and shared almost 100 staff logins for Australia's Big Four banks, putting those businesses at a higher risk of mass data theft and ransomware attacks, cyber security researchers say.

title.children: Hackers have stolen almost 100 staff logins at the Big Four banks, experts say

image.altText: Anthony Albanese NPC for Speers Column

props.synopsis: It's a sign that cost of living alone isn't enough for the Coalition at this point to convince undecided voters to boot out a first term government.

title.children: Dutton turns to Voice as cost of living alone won't save the Coalition

image.altText: a bald male politician wearing glasses speaks in front of a man standing behind him

props.synopsis: Shadow Treasurer Angus Taylor will claim the Coalition's budget deficits would be at least $10 billion smaller than Labor's forecast $150 billion shortfalls over four years.

title.children: Coalition to release 'materially better, in double digits' budget costings

image.altText: a male politician wearing a shirt saying 'fighting for renters' at a press conference

props.synopsis: Founded on Australia's environmental movement, the Greens have shifted focus to rental affordability. Some say it's an "incredibly smart" strategy.

title.children: How the Greens rebranded from activists to the 'party of renters'

image.altText: green how to vote cards in the background with a text box that says enter your suburb

props.synopsis: The full set of major party players' how-to-vote guides for the House of Representatives reveals some surprising alliances.

title.children: The strange 'ballot-fellows' revealed on parties' how-to-vote cards

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: As voters head to the ballot box prepared to cast votes on the issue of housing affordability, new data shows national house prices trended higher in April, and are expected to keep rising as interest rates fall.

title.children: House prices lift ahead of federal election, rate cuts to keep them higher

image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiling with several cameras behind him.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese is starting the day campaigning in Perth and Peter Dutton is back in Brisbane. Follow live.

title.children: PM lands in Perth and Peter Dutton is back in Brisbane

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Anika Wells on News Breakfast now

image.altText: Man in a suit speaking into a microphone behind a podium while holding up a chart

props.synopsis: A flood of imports into the United States ahead of the Trump administration's tariffs have dampened economic growth.

title.children: US economy shrinks in first quarter of Trump's second term

image.altText: A yellow pig-nosed turtle with a little skin tag goatee sticks its head above creek water.

props.synopsis: With Australia in the grip of what many consider a biodiversity crisis, here's what the major parties have promised when it comes to nature laws and the environment.

title.children: As election day nears, one topic has been largely ignored: the environment

image.altText: Close up shot of arms holding a small child, whose bare leg and foot are visible.

props.synopsis: A Brisbane couple could face prosecution after they admitted to using a commercial surrogacy service to have a baby abroad, but experts say the laws need to change.

title.children: Couple who used overseas surrogate to have baby could face prosecution

image.altText: A man in religious dress, with his hands pressed together in prayer.

props.synopsis: As dean of the College of Cardinals, this is supposed to be Giovanni Battista Re's moment. There's just one problem: the 91-year-old won't be in the Sistine Chapel when voting for a new pope begins next week.

title.children: This conclave, some of the most influential cardinals won't even be inside

image.altText: An Indian border guard raises his hand in a gesture indicating stop to a car with two women in the back.

props.synopsis: Following a deadly militant attack, Pakistan and India have hit each other with a range of tough measures including cancelling visas, which has left families separated and wondering when they will be able to reunite.

title.children: 'We shouldn't have come': The families stranded at the Indian border

image.altText: Composite images of three people - two women and a man - smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: After five weeks, and tens of thousands of contributions, the ABC's Your Say project has finished this election campaign where it began — with voters appealing for bolder ambition from their political leaders.

title.children: Days out from the federal election, this is what voters are telling Your Say

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy talks with a laughing Donald Trump

props.synopsis: The agreement would see Washington and Kyiv jointly develop Ukraine's mineral resources, an arrangement US President Donald Trump has called "money back" for the wartime aid it has received from America.

title.children: US and Ukraine minerals deal could be signed within 'next 24 hours'

image.altText: Mark Carney grinning and raising the palms of both hands while standing in front of a blurred Canadian flag and wearing a suit

props.synopsis: The newly-elected Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is set to visit the White House within a week in the hope of securing a fresh trade deal, according to US President Donald Trump.

title.children: Canadian PM will visit White House to sign new trade deal, Trump says

image.altText: katy perry

props.synopsis: Pop star Katy Perry says online criticism over her recent space trip has left her feeling "battered and bruised", but reassured fans she was "OK".

title.children: Katy Perry says Blue Origin backlash made her feel like a 'human piñata'

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The local share market is set to drop on Thursday after a volatile day on Wall Street, as the US economy reverses as Trump's tariffs bite. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set to slip after volatile day on Wall Street as US economy shrinks

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: A look at Wall Street: Nasdaq down, Dow and S&P 500 up

image.altText: King Charles waving with a smile as he leaves a church service.

props.synopsis: It is the most candid the King has been about his health challenges since being diagnosed in February 2024.

title.children: King Charles opens up about 'frightening' and 'daunting' cancer experience

image.altText: A graphic with 15 faces with the words 'Your Say'

props.synopsis: Some Tasmanians are considering voting for non-major party candidates for the first time at Saturday's federal election, saying they are increasingly dissatisfied with the policies of Labor and the Liberals.

title.children: Some voters considering first-time vote away from major parties

image.altText: A view of the Jerusalem skyline shrouded in smoke.

props.synopsis: Dry and windy conditions fanned the flames, forcing motorists on the main highway between Jerusalem and Tel Aviv to abandon their cars and run for their lives.

title.children: Israel calls for international help as wildfires erupt near Jerusalem

image.altText: A woman in a navy sweater sorts eggs

props.synopsis: Communities in the region surrounding Canberra are urging candidates not to forget their specific needs as the federal election approaches.

title.children: Minutes from Canberra, these towns still need more of the basics

image.altText: Grey horse crosses the line at races

props.synopsis: A review of the Northern Territory racing industry is being undertaken by a consultancy firm that also represents Australia’s largest gambling company, sparking questions about its integrity.

title.children: Firm linked to major gambling company conducting NT government racing review

image.altText: A politician looking away from the camera.

props.synopsis: All venues to be built for the 2032 Brisbane Olympic and Paralympic Games, including the Victoria Park stadium, are set to be exempt from major planning rules — but some are questioning why safeguards are being removed.

title.children: Government to override 15 planning laws for 2032 Olympic venues

image.altText: A woman with a shovel

props.synopsis: The Queensland government says illegal gardeners are putting their health at risk by eating food grown on an unused plot of land in Brisbane's West End.

title.children: City's guerilla gardeners defy government health warnings

image.altText: Phoenix Crossland of the Knights interacts with fans in the front row following an NRL match

props.synopsis: Getting ready for a massive weekend of rugby league? Here is your guide to the NRL Magic Round and the Women's State of Origin.

title.children: Everything you need to know about Magic Round and Women's State of Origin

image.altText: Iga Świątek  plays a backhand return at the Madrid Open.

props.synopsis: After losing the first six games, defending champion Iga Świątek recovers to defeat Australian Open champion Madison Keys in their quarterfinal in Madrid.

title.children: 'One of the weirdest matches I played': Świątek reaches Madrid Open semis

image.altText: Rodney Croome Portrait

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian equality activist of over 30 years says Burnie Council's decision to implement pro-LGBTQIA+ initiatives is "one of the most important milestones" he's experienced.

title.children: Once home to 'most homophobic town', this area's council tries to shake off anti-gay image

image.altText: trans flag 1

props.synopsis: The UK's first openly transgender judge said she plans to take the British government to the European court of human rights over its recent ruling on biological sex.

title.children: UK's first trans judge to challenge gender ruling in European court

image.altText: Kylie Minogue singing on stage

props.synopsis: Pop royalty Kylie Minogue has been honoured for her outstanding contribution to the Australian music industry at this year's APRA Music Awards.

title.children: Kylie honoured for outstanding contribution to Australian music

image.altText: A composite image of two people with blurred faces wearing blue Liberal Party t-shirts.

props.synopsis: Members of a secretive Christian sect are being given instructions on how to lie about their beliefs against voting in elections, in an apparent coordinated effort to campaign for the Liberal and National parties.

title.children: Secretive church sect followers told to deny beliefs on voting, in campaign backing Coalition

image.altText: Peter Dutton smiles, standing among a group of people in a darkened room. Above them are strings of lights.

props.synopsis: The prime minister accused Peter Dutton of "verballing" Penny Wong, Clive Palmer is spamming voters and Donald Trump might call Australia back after all.

title.children: Is the Voice back? Peter Dutton wants you to believe it is

image.altText: Heavy machinery demolishing a partially damaged house as men watch on.

props.synopsis: The Myanmar military has been accused of hoarding life-saving relief while survivors endure soaring heat, disease, and displacement in earthquake-shattered Myanmar.

title.children: One month after huge quake, Myanmar faces double crisis

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson served meals to guests at a fateful lunch at her home on different coloured plates to the one she served herself, a jury has been told.

title.children: Erin Patterson's lawyer tells jury mushroom poisoning deaths were 'a terrible accident'
